bibl.title: Na zachód od Aleksandrii..., czyli o polskich wykopaliskach w Ptolemais (2001-2009). [West of Alexandria..., on Polish excavations in Ptolemais (2001–2009).]
bibl.note: Ptolemais, a city located in Cyrenaica, was established in the third century B.C. and survived almost unchanged until as late as the seventh century A.D. The Polish Archaeological Mission of the Institute of Archaeology at University of Warsaw embraced the task of investigating one insula in the residential quarter, which was in intensive use from the third century B.C. all the way to the fifth, perhaps the sixth century A.D. An interim analysis of the architectural detail was performed. Its results on the one hand confirm a strong influence of Alexandria, and on the other hand testify to typically Roman inspirations. - Avec résumés en anglais et en polonais.

bibl.title: Non solum villae. Księga jubileuszowa ofiarowana Profesorowi Stanisławowi Medekszy.

bibl.seg: Monika Rekowska-Ruszkowska & Jakub Kaniszewski, Na zachód od Aleksandrii..., czyli o polskich wykopaliskach w Ptolemais (2001-2009). [West of Alexandria..., on Polish excavations in Ptolemais (2001–2009).]
Jacek Kościuk (ed.), Non solum villae. Księga jubileuszowa ofiarowana Profesorowi Stanisławowi Medekszy (Wrocław, 2010) pp. 265-282, 9 figg.

Ptolemais, a city located in Cyrenaica, was established in the third century B.C. and survived almost unchanged until as late as the seventh century A.D. The Polish Archaeological Mission of the Institute of Archaeology at University of Warsaw embraced the task of investigating one insula in the residential quarter, which was in intensive use from the third century B.C. all the way to the fifth, perhaps the sixth century A.D. An interim analysis of the architectural detail was performed. Its results on the one hand confirm a strong influence of Alexandria, and on the other hand testify to typically Roman inspirations. - Avec résumés en anglais et en polonais.
